daycare_access_scores:daycare_cnt.long_name: Access to day care by capacity
daycare_access_scores:daycare_cnt.short_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations
daycare_access_scores:daycare_cnt.long_description: Count of day care capacity (seats) based on provider locations. Address and capacity data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool.

daycare_access_scores:daycare_3sfca.long_name: Day care geographic availability (3-step floating catchment area)
daycare_access_scores:daycare_3sfca.short_description: Index of day care availability based on supply of and demand for providers
daycare_access_scores:daycare_3sfca.long_description: Day care availability based on 3-step floating catchment areas. This method is an aggregation of day care facilities per population ratios weighted by distance or travel time in each catchment area (area within which a provider is accessible). Provider address data were collected from Virginia Department of Social Services day care search tool. The demand for day care services is the population 0-15 years old and the supply is the capacity of day cares (number of seats).

daycare_access_scores:daycare_median_dri.long_name: Day care availability by median drive time to the five closest day cares in minutes
daycare_access_scores:daycare_median_dri.short_description: Median drive time (minutes) to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region
daycare_access_scores:daycare_median_dri.long_description: Median drive time in minutes to the five closest day cares from centroid of selected region. Address data were collected from the Virginia Department of Social Services Child Day Care Facility search (Dataset for year 2019). Drive times were computed using Open Source Routing Machine (Using roads for year 2022).
daycare_access_scores:daycare_median_dri.statement: The median drive time to the five closest day cares to {features.name} is {value}.

savitz20.title: Treatment selection and medication adherence for stable angina: The role of area-based health literacy
savitz20.journal: Journal of Evaluation in Clinical Practice

wan12.title: A three-step floating catchment area method for analyzing spatial access to health services
wan12.journal: International Journal of Geographical Information Science

bii21.title: catchment: Calculate spatial access and availability metrics

health_literacy_estimates:health_literac.short_description: Health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions
health_literacy_estimates:health_literac.long_description: The health literacy composite captures the adult population's ability to obtain, process, and understand basic health services to make appropriate health decisions. Health literacy composite is based on variables of demographic characteristics, health status, and health care use.
health_literacy_estimates:health_literac.statement: The health literacy composite for {features.name} is {value}.

post_hs_education:perc_post_hs_edu.short_description: Percentage of the population self-reported to have post-secondary education
post_hs_education:perc_post_hs_edu.long_description: Percentage of the population self-reported to have post-secondary education. Based on American Community Survey Table B15003 in ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
post_hs_education:perc_post_hs_edu.statement: {value} of the population in {features.name} has a post-secondary education.

post_hs_education:num_post_hs_edu.long_name: Number of people with post-secondary education
post_hs_education:num_post_hs_edu.short_description: Number of people who self-reported to have post-secondary education
post_hs_education:num_post_hs_edu.long_description: Number of people who self-reported to have post-secondary education. Based on American Community Survey Table B15003 in ACS 2015/2019 5-year estimates.
post_hs_education:num_post_hs_edu.statement: {value} people in {features.name} have a post-secondary education.

nces:schools_2year_per_100k.short_description: Number of 2-year schools per 100k people over 14.
nces:schools_2year_per_100k.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
nces:schools_2year_per_100k.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

nces:schools_2year_min_drivetime.short_description: Drive time to the nearest 2-year schools.
nces:schools_2year_min_drivetime.long_description: Minimal drive time to a school authorized to award Associates degrees or 2-year or longer certificates from the Census block group centroid, as calculated by the Open Source Routing Machine in 2022. School locations are from the National Center for Education Statistics. All distances are calculated at the block group level, then averaged up to higher-level geographies.
nces:schools_2year_min_drivetime.statement: It takes {value} to drive to a 2-year school from {features.name}'s block group centroids on average.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

nces:schools_under2year_per_100k.short_description: Number of <2-year schools per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
nces:schools_under2year_per_100k.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award certificates that are typically obtained in less than 2 years per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) <2-year schools as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
nces:schools_under2year_per_100k.statement: There are {value} <2-year schools per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

nces:schools_under2year_min_drivetime.short_description: Drive time to the nearest <2-year schools.
nces:schools_under2year_min_drivetime.long_description: Minimal drive time to a schools authorized to award certificates that are typically obtained in less than 2 years from the Census block group centroid, as calculated by the Open Source Routing Machine in 2022. School locations are from the National Center for Education Statistics. All distances are calculated at the block group level, then averaged up to higher-level geographies.
nces:schools_under2year_min_drivetime.statement: It takes {value} to drive to a <2-year school from {features.name}'s block group centroids on average.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics

nces:schools_2year_with_biomedical_progr.short_description: Number of 2-year schools with biomedical programs per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
nces:schools_2year_with_biomedical_progr.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or less than 2-year or longer certificates with biomedical programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 26) per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools with any degrees conferred in the given year with a CIP code starting with 26, as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
nces:schools_2year_with_biomedical_progr.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools with a biomedical program per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics and Completions files

nces:schools_2year_with_computer_program.long_name: 2-year computer science programs per 100k people over 14
nces:schools_2year_with_computer_program.short_description: Number of 2-year schools with computer science programs per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
nces:schools_2year_with_computer_program.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or less than 2-year or longer certificates with computer science programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 11) per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools with any degrees conferred in the given year with a CIP code starting with 11, as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
nces:schools_2year_with_computer_program.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools with a computer science program per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics and Completions files

nces:schools_2year_with_engineering_prog.long_name: 2-year engineering or related programs per 100k people over 14
nces:schools_2year_with_engineering_prog.short_description: Number of 2-year schools with engineering or related programs per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
nces:schools_2year_with_engineering_prog.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or less than 2-year or longer certificates with engineering or related programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 14 or 15) per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools with any degrees conferred in the given year with a CIP code starting with 14 or 15, as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
nces:schools_2year_with_engineering_prog.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools with a engineering or related program per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.name: National Center for Education Statistics
sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics and Completions files

nces:schools_2year_with_physical_program.short_description: Number of 2-year schools with physical science programs per 100k people over 14, calculated within floating catchment areas.
nces:schools_2year_with_physical_program.long_description: Number of schools authorized to award Associates degrees or less than 2-year or longer certificates with physical science programs (any with Classification of Institutional Programs [CIP] codes starting with 40) per 100k people over 14, based on 3-step floating catchment areas defined by distance. Catchment areas were calculated using (a) 2-year schools with any degrees conferred in the given year with a CIP code starting with 40, as listed by the National Center for Education Statistics, with supply values of 1, (b) Census block groups, with supply values as the population over the age of 14 as reported the American Community Survey 5-year summaries, and (c) distances between school locations and block group centroids, weighted by a Gaussian function with a scaling parameter set to 18, as calculated by the catchment R package.
nces:schools_2year_with_physical_program.statement: There are {value} 2-year schools with a physical science program per 100k people over 14 in {features.name}.

sources.location: Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System, Institutional Characteristics and Completions files

3rd_grade_mean_median_read_score:median_.long_name: Median percentage of 3rd graders passing reading test
3rd_grade_mean_median_read_score:median_.short_description: Median percentage of 3rd grade population passing reading test for schools in the region
3rd_grade_mean_median_read_score:median_.long_description: Median percentage of 3rd grade population passing reading test. The median is calculated across schools in the region.
3rd_grade_mean_median_read_score:median_.statement: On average, {value} of 3rd graders pass reading in {features.name}.

3rd_grade_mean_median_read_score:mean_re.long_name: Mean percentage of 3rd graders passing reading test
3rd_grade_mean_median_read_score:mean_re.short_description: Mean percentage of 3rd grade population passing reading test for schools in the region
